data_answer: As he walked away, Will thought of all the things they could do. Maybe watch some tv, play some games.... When he got to the kitchen he glanced out the window at the familiar green field that spread out underneath his window. Will's hand found the little notch where the phone was always put. He sighed as his fingers found the number he had dialed time after time. Again Will looked out the window,this time a little less mournfully so. Suddenly, an idea hit him hard. Why hadn't he thought of it before? When Will's friends answered the phone, they all agreed to his idea. They drove up to his driveway in galoshes, raincoats, hats, and carring umbrellas. They stomped into his yard, laughing and talking. Will met them out in his backyard and then they began to stomp in puddles, throw mudballs at each other, and remember how it was to be a little kid again. When Will glanced up very quickly midst a mudball fight, he saw his mother with a cup of steamy hot chocolate, smiling as she watched the fight. When she saw Will looking at her, she smiled even wider and waved. Will gave his mom a big thumbs-up, right as a wet slimy mudball smashed into his face. He laughed along with everyone else, promising whoever threw that mudball would be sorry, all the while still laughing.This still really is the best day of the week! Will thought

data_answer: Will ran to the phone throwing his baseball glove. Eagerly he lunged towards the phone book and found Ryan, Adam, and Jason's phone number. The phone rang loudly in his ear. "Hello?" Ryan answered sounding dissapointed and dreary. "Hey dude, you should come over to my place. We can chilll and play video game. " Dude, we should also like totally watch the Giants and the Rangers!" "How about 12:00 to 8:00; dinner is on me!" Will said basically jumping up and down. "Sounds good bro, see ya soon!" Will had basically that same conversation with the rest rest of the boys and it turned out, all the boys were as anxious as Will was. "Thanks mom!" Will said. He silently thought I don't know what I'd do without her. The next ten minutes seemed like years to Will as he stood behind his dooor on the front porch and awaited the arrival of his baseball buddies. By the time the boys were all there Will's mom had cooked up some popcorn, burgers, and a heaping bowl of candy. Will and his buddies laughed and had lots of fun whether it was watching the nail biting game or playing Zombie Attack ,I crave 4 brains. The night quickly passed by and the hours they'd spent together felt like only ten minutes. "This rainy Saturday really wasn't that bad at all, not only because the Giants won. Thanks for helping me mom!" Will said. He gave his mom a big hug and small kiss. With that Will put on his pajamas, brushed his teeth, and went to bed grinning ear to ear.

data_answer: Will ran to the phone and called five of his friends. "Hey guys, meet me at the baseball field, I know it's raining, but I have a plan!" Will grabbed his raincoat, boots, and glove. He zoomed out of the door. Though before he could get there, Mom was standing in the doorway. "Where are you going?" she asked. "I'm going to the field, you said I could come up with a plan", Will answered. "Ok then, but-" "BYE!" Will raced out to the front yard, grabbed his bike and pedaled to the field. When he got there, his friends were waiting in their coats under the bleachers."Hey! You guys came! So here is my plan to save Saturday." "Wait a minute", his friend Logan said,"Why are we saving Saturday?" "Oh! I forgot to tell you! We all love baseball right?" They nodded."Plus, game day is even better! So I thought we could do something! My plan is we can still play baseball, but not outside! We can play at the indoor sports center down the street! I called them and they are free! So if we car pool, maybe using help from our parents we can get the game back on!" "YEAH!" They all yelled. Logan called coach to tell him the idea and he loved it! Will called everyones parents to car pool and they were there in five minutes! "We did it guys, great job" "We couldn't of done it without you Will", said Logan. Then they walked together to get in the cars.

data_answer: Will ran down the hall to the phone and punched in his friend Matthew's number. Matthew picked up and grumpily said, "Hi Will. I bet you're disappointed about the weather too, right?" "Yeah, but I have a plan that will turn this day of boredom into a day of fun!" replied Will, and told Matthew his plan. "That's a great idea! I'll call Devin and R.J., and you call Ryan and Aiden," said Matthew. "Then, you get to work preparing your house, and I'll come over with the games and DVD's."Quickly, they both got to work. After calling his two friends, Will started working on the decorations. He turned his family room into a movie theatre. He turned his bedroom into a game room. He also made popcorn and poured soda. At 10:30 AM, Matthew came over with the discs. soon, at 11:00, Ryan, Aiden, R.J., and Devin showed up. "We are going to have a Lord of the Rings marathon!" exclaimed Will. "Cool!" everyone else said. The plan was to watch all three Lord of the Rings movies, then play Lord of the Rings video games, and have a Lord of the Rings themed sleepover. It turned out to be a lot of fun, and none of them even remembered that they were supposed to be disappointed about the game.

data_answer: Will ran to the phone and picked it up. He was about to dial up his freind when his mom told him to eat first. "You haven't had any lunch yet," she said. After a quick lunch of Peanut Butter and Jelly, he picked the phone and called all his friends from the team. He said, "Meet me at my house as soon as you can." Slowly, they all came. "I was thinking of doing something," Will exclaimed. "We could go to the gym near my house to practice and get even better!" One of them, John the pitcher, said "That's a great idea! But I have these stupid banjo lessons at one fifteen, so we only have an hour fifteen minutes." David, the catcher, laughed nervously. "You take banjo lessons?" John's face turned bright red. "Anyway, we should get going before one." When they got there, the other team was there, too. No! Will thought. Not you guys! It's just supposed to be us! Eventually, the other team noticed them. The leader, Jackson, stepped forward. "What are you doing here?" he asked. Will said, "Same as you. Too practice so we can get better and mop the floor with you." This kept going, and finally, they had a pregame in the gym. Unfortunetly, John had to go. It was close, but the other team won. They started bragging they would win this game. Will's team got out of the gym and went back to the house. They had ice cream, and said, "Why win when your mom makes good homemade ice cream?" They had lost the pregame, but Will was happy. The rest of the team, too. Even though John had to go, they still had fun.

"Don't you think we need to stop the rain for our game?" asked Will. "Yes! Why don't you check the weather report?" said Larry. "Okay! Bye!" said Will. "See you later!" said Larry. Will hung up the phone and ran to check the weather report on the TV. He turned on channel 5 and the weatherman said, "Heavy rain but it looks like by Saturday there will be no rain just sun. data_answer: Will was about to reach for telephone when he suddenly remembered about a fight he had with all his friends. It was baseball practice time, and the coach had divided the team into two groups to have a practice play. Will had reached first base, but the other team caught the ball in time, so he was out. Will said that he was safe, but their coach said that he was out. Will complained and complained, and soon everyone, even the people who were in his group, said Will was out. Will remembered he had stomped off the field and ran all the way home. Now, Will wished that he could have just sat down on the benches and admit he was out. He sighed. All of a sudden, he heard a twinkling sound above his head. He couldn't believe his eyes. There was a fairy in his room! "W-Who are you!", Will exclamied. "I am Ann.", the fairy replied calmly back. Ann was wearing a furry sweater, along with blue jeans. "You semm pretty upset. What's the matter?" Will sighed again and told the fairy everything. How the championship game was canceled, how he and his friends got into a fight. "Hmm. Sound's like you need to apologize.", said Ann. Will said,"I know, but I'm afraid that my friends won't listen." "Well, you have to try.", Ann said. Will slowly dragged himself to the phone. He dialed the number and waited. "Hello?", a voice said. Will knew it was his bect buddy, Arnold. Will apologized and asked if he could forgive him. Silence. Then Arnold said,"I can forgive you." Will jumped up with joy. "How about this", Arnold said." Come over to my house. Everyone else is here. We are watching movies." Will said yes and hung up. Ann had disappeared. Will said softly," Thank you Ann." He ran downstairs and shouted,"Mom, can you drive me to Arnold's house?"

data_answer: Will called all his baseball team to find something to do. They all sat in the den to give out suggestions. So far, nobody had a clue what to do. Then Will's mom came in the door. She said,"Oh come on boys, you can think better than that! Use your imagination." The boys thought incredibly hard. Then Will jumped up shouting, "I know what we could do!" "We could make a fort, tell scary stories, and have pillow fights!" exclaimed Will. Everyone sat up chairs and stools to make the fort. Will's mom gathered all the blankets she could find. Then the boys told scary stories that made everyone shake, had pillow fights that made everyone laugh, and Will's mom even made popcorn so they can watch a movie. As time went by, Will eventually had to bid his baseball team goodbye. "I'll see you at the championship!" Will called out. As he walked back into the house, he said, "Thanks Mom, you really did save my Saturday."

data_answer: Will called all the kids on the baseball team. He wouldn't tell them his idea. All he told him was that it would be great. All the kids from the baseball team shortly arrived at Will's house. All the kids asked," What is your idea!" He finally said," You know how my mom knows coach very well?" "Yes, why?" the kids from the team asked. "We're driving to coach's house!" "Yay!" Later that day the team went to the coach's house. They found out the hard way at school that when coach is taking a nap you DON'T wake him up. What do you know. When we got to his house we could see him throught the window and he was taking a nap! I was hoping he had some hope we were going to have the championships. Everyone on the team knew he had a "secret" crush on my mother so I bet some how she could charm him. We decided that my mom should wake him up. He finally woke up after about thirty minutes. He was very alarmed. "Who are you? Why are you in my hou-" coach screamed. "It's me! Will's mother." my mother explained. "Well, hello there!" coach said. "I was wondering if we could get the Championships back on?" my mother grinned at me. "Ummmm, well," We all were crossing our fingers. "Anything for you. I mean why not!" "Thankyou sir!" my mother said. We were all so excited that we all started jumping. Coach hadn't known we were in his house and well some of us broke a lot of stuff. He jumped as soon as he heard it. "What was that?" coach asked. "What was what?" my mother asked while she was totally saving us. "Oh, maybe I was just hearing something. "Probably." After that my mother rushed him out of bed. He told my mother to go away while he was changing. She was way ahead of him. He saw us and the glass broken everywhere. He was about to yell but my mother calmed him down. Soon we were at the game field. We called the other team and in about foruty five minutes they were there. We explained everything to them and they understood. They called all the fans that they have and soon enough everyone was here. At the end of the game I was pitching. I knew that right now everyone depended on me and so did the score. The score was tied 64-64. My group had a secret pitch that we made from the beginning of the tryouts. We make different hand signals for other ones but this was the one. I made the hand signal and the pitcher was terrified. I threw it and closed my eyes. I was crying on the inside. I didn't here a hit so when I opened my eyes I looked around. The other teams fans were not cheering. Neither were they. I thought to myself did I win the game? Then I looked at the pitcher. He caught the ball. It seemed as if my teams fans didn't start cheering until they knew that we had won. After the game my mom took me and my team out for hotdogs and fries. They were delicious! "Thanks a lot mom!" "Your welcome." All my friends started going home and I went to bed and dreamed about the game over and over.

data_answer: Will hurried down the hall to the telephone table, near the couch to make for an easy reach, and picked up the little black phone with silver buttons. His fingers had dialed Billy's ( One of his closest friends) number so many times that they did it without thought. Riiing. Riiing. Riing. Will felt as if the telephone was ringing in slow motion. He thought Billy would never pick up. Suddenly, though, he did pick up. "Hello?" "Hey, it's Will. You want to go to the skating rink or something? I can't believe this rain." "Sure! I'll call the rest of the guys." Will fele relieved as he hung up the little black phone with silver buttons. His mother had heard the whole conversation and offered to drive Will to the rink. As he climbed into the car, he swung his skates into the backseat and thought about last time he had skated. The smile as wide as a rainbow returned. Billy, Wil, and the rest of the guys skated around, had hockey stick jousting matches, and drank hot chocolate until it was time to go home.
